eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LeaderboardDialog
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Display the score and let players choose what to do next.
description: Display the score and let players choose what to do next:
- Submit the score to a leaderboard
- Go back to the main menu

eventsFunctions.sentence: Events are running for the editor

eventsFunctions.name: ToFixed

eventsBasedObjects.description: Display the score and let players choose what to do next.
eventsBasedObjects.name: LeaderboardDialog

events.comment:
Handle leaderboards.
To create a leaderboard, make sure your game is registered in Home > Profile > Games Dashboard and then, click on "Manage game" > Leaderboards. When a leaderboard is created, it should be available in the actions.

eventsFunctions.name: Score

eventsFunctions.description: the best score of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: BestScore

eventsFunctions.name: PlayerName

events.comment: Allow to try and submit again in case of error.

eventsFunctions.description: the leaderboard of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: LeaderboardId

eventsFunctions.name: TweenIn

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TweenIntoView
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Tween objects into position from off screen.
description: Tween objects into position from off screen, or from a set distance, to create a polished visual effect.
When objects are created, or if they exist at the beginning of the scene, they are put ouside of screen and tweened back to their initial position.
This extension can be used to:
- Make smooth transitions for in UI

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Tween objects into position from off screen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TweenIntoView

events.comment:
doStepPostEvents is used to avoid a 1-frame delay:
- The objects are created (by events or at the scene creation)
- doStepPostEvents trigger tweens
- The frame is displayed
- The tween behavior start moving the objects
We do it here because the object position is not yet known from onCreated.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the X position at the beginning of the fade-in.
eventsFunctions.name: OriginX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the Y position at the beginning of the fade-in.
eventsFunctions.name: OriginY

eventsFunctions.description: Tween the object to its set starting position.
eventsFunctions.name: TweenIn

events.comment:
When an animation is already occuring, we only start it back from the start
because current object position is unlikly to be relevent.

eventsFunctions.description: Tween the object to its off screen position.
eventsFunctions.name: TweenOut

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance
propertyDescriptors.description: Leave this value at 0 to move the object in from outside of the screen.
propertyDescriptors.name: Distance

propertyDescriptors.label: Tween in the object at creation
propertyDescriptors.name: ShouldPlayAtCreation

propertyDescriptors.label: Delete the object when TweenOut action is finished
propertyDescriptors.name: ShouldBeDeleted

propertyDescriptors.label: The X position at the beginning of fade in
propertyDescriptors.name: TargetX

propertyDescriptors.label: The Y position at the beginning of fade in
propertyDescriptors.name: TargetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the events are running for the editor.
eventsFunctions.name: IsInGameEdition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Events are running for the editor

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.
